http://www.pollingreport.com/abortion.htm
 
 A new poll from CBS shows 56% of people are against abortion except for rape/incest/mothers life or less.
 
 Only 25% say it should be legal in all cases.
 
 Coming from CBS means that the 25% if probably high emoticon_xclown

There are lots of figures on that site. 
 
 "Do you think abortions should be legal under any circumstances, legal only under certain circumstances, or illegal in all circumstances?"
 
 The results for this show that support for abortion fluctuates. The figures do however remain fairly stable (for around 25%, sometimes for 55%, against 17%). Overall there's very little change and I don't see any major trends.
 
 -Wez

the site is in order...if you look at all of them then it seems to be a slight shift for more people against abortion
 
 admittably the polls are very inconsistent depending on the question. Support for Roe vs Wade is insanly high for one thing.

the site is in order...if you look at all of them then it seems to be a slight shift for more people against abortion

 I don't see this trend. I see lots of contradictory stats that can be used to prove either point of view equally, depending on the sources you use. There's no way I'm even going to try to check the validity of all those types of stats, so I have no idea of their accuracy either.
